sen.j: 倭国造（やまとのくにのみやつこ・やまとこくぞう)は大和国中央部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Yamato no Kuni no Miyatsuko (倭国造) was a Kuni no Miyatsuko (the head of a local government) who ruled over the center of Yamato Province.
Yamato no Kuni no Miyatsuko (also called 'Yamato Kokuzo') was a Kuni no Miyatsuko (the head of a local government) who ruled over the center of Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: (倭国造)漢字表記を訳に残す必要はないので削除しました。名前の読みに二つあり、一つ訳出されていなかったので、(also called 'Yamato Kokuzo')と追加しました。
sen.e: Yamato no Kuni no Miyatsuko (also called 'Yamato Kokuzo') was a Kuni no Miyatsuko (the head of a local government) who ruled over the center of Yamato Province.

sen.j: 大倭国造とも。
sen.e: Also written as 大倭国造.
Also written as "大倭国造".
sen.cmt: 漢字表記の箇所に" "を加えました。
sen.e: Also written as "大倭国造".

sen.j: 後には大和国造を称した。
sen.e: Later written as 大和国造.
Later written as "大和国造".
sen.cmt: 漢字表記の箇所に" "を加えました。
sen.e: Later written as "大和国造".

sen.j: 珍彦。
sen.e: Uzuhiko
Uzuhiko
Uzuhiko

sen.j: 神武天皇の東征において功があり、神武天皇二年に初めて倭国造に任じられたという。
sen.e: He made his name during Emperor Jinmu's expedition to the east, and he was appointed as Yamato no Kuni no Miyatsuko for the first time in the second year of the reign of Emperor Jinmu.
He made his name during the Eastern Expedition of the Emperor Jinmu, and he was appointed as the Yamato no Kuni no Miyatsuko for the first time in 658 B.C.
sen.cmt: Emperor Jinmu's expedition to the east→the Eastern Expedition of the Emperor Jinmuに変更しました。 in the second year of the reign of Emperor Jinmuは誤訳です。神武天皇二年→in 658 B.C.
sen.e: He made his name during the Eastern Expedition of the Emperor Jinmu, and he was appointed as the Yamato no Kuni no Miyatsuko for the first time in 658 B.C.

sen.j: 倭氏。
sen.e: The Yamato Clan.
The clan was Yamato.
sen.cmt: The Yamato Clan→The clan was Yamatoに変更しました。
sen.e: The clan was Yamato.

sen.j: 国名の変遷とともに氏族名も変わった(大倭・大養徳・大和など)。
sen.e: As the Kanji for the name of the country was changed, the Kanji for the name of the clan was also changed (大倭, 大養徳, 大和 and so forth).
As the Kanji for the name of the country was changed, the Kanji for the name of the clan was also changed (大倭, 大養徳, 大和 and so on [all of them were called 'Yamato']).
sen.cmt: and so forth→and so onに変更しました。漢字についての読みが言及されていなかったので[all of them were called 'Yamato']を追加しました。
sen.e: As the Kanji for the name of the country was changed, the Kanji for the name of the clan was also changed (大倭, 大養徳, 大和 and so on [all of them were called 'Yamato']).

sen.j: 姓は直だが、天武天皇10年(681年)に倭竜麻呂が連姓に、12年に一族が連に、14年に忌寸姓に、さらに奈良時代には大和長岡と水守が宿禰に昇格した。
sen.e: His surname was Atai, but in 681 Yamato no Tatsumaro's surname became Muraji, and in 683 the entire clan became Muraji, in 685 became Imiki, and in the Nara era, Yamato no Nagaoka and Mizumori were promoted to Sukune.

Although his surname was Atai, Yamato no Tatsumaro's surname became Muraji in 681, the surname of the entire clan became Muraji in 683 and became Imiki in 685, and Yamato no Nagaoka and Mizumori were promoted to Sukune in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 自然な流れの文章ではなかったので全体を見直しました。
sen.e: Although his surname was Atai, Yamato no Tatsumaro's surname became Muraji in 681, the surname of the entire clan became Muraji in 683 and became Imiki in 685, and Yamato no Nagaoka and Mizumori were promoted to Sukune in the Nara period.

sen.j: なお、和氏は百済の国王・武寧王の子孫なので、別系統である。
sen.e: It should be noted that Kazuuji descended from Muryeong-wan, King of Baekje, so it was a different lineage.
It should be noted that Kazuuji descended from Muryeong-wang, King of Baekje, therefore it was a different lineage.
sen.cmt: Muryeong-wan→スペルミスです。so→thereforeに変更しました。
sen.e: It should be noted that Kazuuji descended from Muryeong-wang, King of Baekje, therefore it was a different lineage.

sen.j: 大和国城下郡大和郷。
sen.e: Yamato Village, Shiki no Shimo no Koori County, Yamato Province.
Yamato clan was located in Yamato Village, Shiki no Shimo no Kori County, Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: Yamato clan was located in追加しました。Koori→母音が重なっているのでKoriに修正しました。County,→コンマ前のスペース削除しました。
sen.e: Yamato clan was located in Yamato Village, Shiki no Shimo no Kori County, Yamato Province.

sen.j: 現在の奈良県天理市。
sen.e: Present day Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
The current location is in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Present dayを削除し、The current location isに変更しました。
sen.e: The current location is in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 6～7世紀には磯城・十市地方(奈良盆地東部)も支配していたという。
sen.e: In the 6th and 7th centuries, he also ruled over Shiki and Toochi regions (the eastern part of Nara Basin).
It is said that the Yamato clan ruled over Shiki and Tochi regions (the eastern part of Nara Basin) in the sixth and seventh century.
sen.cmt: 「ていたという。」の部分が訳漏れです。→全体を見直しています。数字の表記に則していないので6th and 7th→に変更しました。centuries→centuryに修正しました。Toochi →母音が重なっているのでTochiに修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that the Yamato clan ruled over Shiki and Tochi regions (the eastern part of Nara Basin) in the sixth and seventh century.

tit.e: The Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion)
Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion)
Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion)

sen.j: 大和坐大国魂神社(やまとにますおおくにたまじんじゃ)。
sen.e: Yamato Nimasu Okunitama-Jinja Shrine.
It was Yamato Nimasu Okunitama-Jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: It was を追加し、文章になるようにしました。
sen.e: It was Yamato Nimasu Okunitama-Jinja Shrine.

sen.j: つまり、大和神社。
sen.e: Namely, Oyamato-jinja Shrine.
In other words, it was Oyamato-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: Namely→In other words, it wasに変更しました。
sen.e: In other words, it was Oyamato-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 垂仁朝に市磯長尾市が倭大国魂神を祭って創始された。
sen.e: In the Suinin period, it was started by Ichishi no Nagaochi worshipping Yamato no Okuni Tama no Kami.
In the Emperor Suinins's era, Ichishi no Nagaochi founded the shrine by worshipping Yamato no Okuni Tama no Kami.
sen.cmt: Suinin period→Emperor Suinins's eraに変更しました。it was started by Ichishi no Nagaochi worshipping→Ichishi no Nagaochi founded the shrine by worshippingに変更しました。
sen.e: In the Emperor Suinins's era, Ichishi no Nagaochi founded the shrine by worshipping Yamato no Okuni Tama no Kami.

sen.j: 倭吾子籠(あごこ) ...... 古墳時代の伝説上の人物。
sen.e: Yamato no Agoko…a legendary person in the Kofun period (Tumulus period).
Yamato no Agoko: He was a legendary person in the Kofun period (Tumulus period).
sen.cmt: …→: に変更しました。He wasを追加しました。
sen.e: Yamato no Agoko: He was a legendary person in the Kofun period (Tumulus period).

sen.j: 仁徳～雄略朝の国造。
sen.e: A Kuni no Miyatsuko (the head of a local government) from the Nintoku period to the Yuryaku period.
He was the Kuni no Miyatsuko from the Emperor Nintoku's era to the Emperor Yuryaku's era.
sen.cmt: He was the を追加しました。(the head of a local government)最初の方のセルで既出事項なので削除しました。Nintoku period→Emperor Nintoku's eraに変更しました。Yuryaku period→Emperor Yuryaku's eraに変更しました。
sen.e: He was the Kuni no Miyatsuko from the Emperor Nintoku's era to the Emperor Yuryaku's era.

sen.j: 皇位継承争いに絡んで履中天皇に殺されかけたが、妹の日之媛を釆女として謙譲したことによって助命された。
sen.e: Because he got himself involved in the Inperial succession conflict, and he was almost killed by Emperor Richu, but he was saved for giving up his younger sister, Hinohime, to be his Uneme (ancient court hostess).

He had almost been killed by Emperor Richu because he got himself involved in the Imperial succession conflict, however, he was saved by presenting his younger sister, Hinohime, as Uneme (ancient court hostess).
sen.cmt: Inperial→スペルミスです。Imperial原文中の「謙譲」は献上の誤植だと思われます。しかし、訳文ではそれに気づかずに訳しているようなので文章全体を見直しました。
sen.e: He had almost been killed by Emperor Richu because he got himself involved in the Imperial succession conflict, however, he was saved by presenting his younger sister, Hinohime, as Uneme (ancient court hostess).

sen.j: 以後、倭氏は大王家に釆女を献上することが恒例になった。
sen.e: After that, it became a custom for the Yamato clan to present an Uneme to the family of Okimi (Great King).
After that, it became a custom for the Yamato clan to present an Uneme to the family of Okimi (Great King).
After that, it became a custom for the Yamato clan to present an Uneme to the family of Okimi (Great King).

sen.j: 倭手彦(てひこ) ...... 古墳時代の将軍。
sen.e: Yamato no Tehiko…a general in the Kofun period.
Yamato no Tehiko: He was a shogun in the Kofun period.
sen.cmt: …→: に変更しました。He wasを追加しました。将軍は一般にshogunでいいと思うので、変更しています。
sen.e: Yamato no Tehiko: He was a shogun in the Kofun period.

sen.j: 欽明朝の国造。
sen.e: A Kuni no Miyatsuko in the Kinmei period.
He was the Kuni no Miyatsuko in the Emperor Kinmei's era.
sen.cmt: He was the を追加しました。Kinmei period→Emperor Kinmei's eraに変更しました。
sen.e: He was the Kuni no Miyatsuko in the Emperor Kinmei's era.

sen.j: 対新羅戦で活躍した。
sen.e: He made his name in the war against Silla.
He made his name in the war against Silla.
He made his name in the war against Silla.

sen.j: 大和長岡 ...... 奈良時代の法律家。
sen.e: Yamato no Nagaoka…a law scholar in the Nara era.
Yamato no Nagaoka: He was a law scholar in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: …→: に変更しました。He wasを追加しました。Nara era→Nara periodに変更しました。
sen.e: Yamato no Nagaoka: He was a law scholar in the Nara period.

sen.j: 大倭国造五百足(いおたり)の子。
sen.e: The son of Yamato no Kuni no Miyatsuko, Iotari.
He was the son of Yamato no Kuni no Miyatsuko Iotari.
sen.cmt: He wasを追加しました。コンマ削除しました。
sen.e: He was the son of Yamato no Kuni no Miyatsuko Iotari.

sen.j: 『養老律令』選定に関与した。
sen.e: He played a part in the adoption of "Yoro Ritsuryo Code."
He was involved in the adoption of "Yoro Ritsuryo Code"(code promulgated in the Yoro period).
sen.cmt: played a part→was involvedに変更しました。" "内にピリオドがあるので外に移動しました。(code promulgated in the Yoro period)を追加しました。
sen.e: He was involved in the adoption of "Yoro Ritsuryo Code"(code promulgated in the Yoro period).
